fdt_parser/cache/
mod.rs

1//! Cached FDT parser with indexed nodes for efficient lookups.
2//!
3//! This module provides a cached representation of the device tree that
4//! builds an index for fast repeated lookups. It uses more memory than the
5//! direct parser but provides O(1) node access by path or phandle.
6
7mod fdt;
8mod node;
9
10use core::ops::Deref;
11
12pub use fdt::*;
13pub use node::*;
14
15/// A 4-byte aligned buffer for storing FDT data.
16///
17/// The Device Tree Blob specification requires 4-byte alignment,
18/// and this wrapper ensures the allocated memory meets that requirement.
19struct Align4Vec {
20    ptr: *mut u8,
21    size: usize,
22}
23
24unsafe impl Send for Align4Vec {}
25
26impl Align4Vec {
27    const ALIGN: usize = 4;
28
29    /// Creates a new 4-byte aligned buffer containing the provided data.
30    pub fn new(data: &[u8]) -> Self {
31        let size = data.len();
32        let layout = core::alloc::Layout::from_size_align(size, Self::ALIGN).unwrap();
33        let ptr = unsafe { alloc::alloc::alloc_zeroed(layout) };
34        unsafe { core::ptr::copy_nonoverlapping(data.as_ptr(), ptr, size) };
35        Align4Vec { ptr, size }
36    }
37}
38
39impl Drop for Align4Vec {
40    /// Deallocates the aligned buffer when dropped.
41    fn drop(&mut self) {
42        let layout = core::alloc::Layout::from_size_align(self.size, Self::ALIGN).unwrap();
43        unsafe { alloc::alloc::dealloc(self.ptr, layout) };
44    }
45}
46
47impl Deref for Align4Vec {
48    type Target = [u8];
49
50    fn deref(&self) -> &Self::Target {
51        unsafe { alloc::slice::from_raw_parts(self.ptr, self.size) }
52    }
53}
